div.p: This element belongs in WRITING PRODUCTION . It contains at least a sentence of information about where significant copies/manuscripts (of her work) or evidence about her resides. It should contain a tagged PLACE (e.g. public library at Northallerton) or an ORGNAME (Folger Shakespeare Library) except in occasional instances of privately owned or equivalent. This element offers data for tracking mss or significant printed copies, collections now extant, copies historically lost or found or only heard of.

div.codeblock: <PARCHIVALLOCATION>The <ORGNAME>Bodleian Library</ORGNAME> has Elizabeth Falkland's presentation copy to James Clayton, formerly fellow of St John's College, Oxford, who wrote prefatory verses for it.</PARCHIVALLOCATION>
<PARCHIVALLOCATION>The William Andrews Clark Memorial Library has recently acquired the original letters by Hannah More on which William Roberts based his 1834 Memoirs of More.</PARCHIVALLOCATION>
